comments:
Using Eclipse 2.0.2 and later M4

Sequence of events:

Yesterday a colleague changed JRE to 1.4.1-01. He claims Eclipse (2.0.2, I
believe) still started properly. This morning, he installed the plugin from
http://eclipse-tools.sourceforge.net/ and suddenly Eclipse wouldn't start up any
more, with the error message below appearing in the log.

We removed the plugin: same problem.
We specified a new workspace on the shortcut: same problem.
We installed M4 (by renaming the old Eclipse installation directory and
unzipping M4: same problem.
Bizarrely, removing the -vm argument from the shortcut, we managed to get
Eclipse to start. Even more bizarrely, putting the argument back, it now works
fine... this might be an impossible bug to get anywhere with, but I thought it
worth submitting anyway in case anyone else had the same problem...

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 05, 2003 09:39:00.322
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.VerifyError: (class: org/eclipse/core/internal/plugins/PluginParser,
method: initializeParser signature: ()V) Incompatible object argument for

We haven't seen anything like this before.
Marking as WORKSFORME.
Please reopen if you have a reproducable test case.
